name: James Chance and the Contortions
description: '''James Chance and the Contortions''' (initially known simply as '''Contortions''', a spin-off group is called '''James White and the Blacks''') was a musical group led by saxophonist and vocalist [[James Chance]], formed in 1977. They were a central act of New York City's downtown [[no wave]] music scene in the late 1970s, and were featured on the influential compilation ''[[No New York]]'' (1978).{{sfn | Masters | Walter | Young | 2007 | p= 74â€“95}}
